item.description:
Hi Everyone,

Thanks for your comments on the recent poll.
The majority of comments are leaning towards Monday .

I am choosing MONDAY also because i see all the predictions indicating winds at or above 10 mph for Sunday (as usual this may be lower ??) but i have seen too may of you struggle in this level of wind. I anticipate Monday to be less wind than this and a few degrees warmer also.


Labor Day: Sunny, with a high near 78. Calm wind becoming west between 5 and 8 mph. THIS IS GOOD ENOUGH.

For more specific weather at our paddling area:
http://www.usairnet.c...

The time is a bit earlier 11:00 am (we are closer to this site compared to the ocean, i expect less traffic, but may have a lot of boaters thinking & doing the same thing, "start a bit earlier--then barbie-q a bit earlier so everyone can go home earlier", etc.

I am going to try to be there and unload at about 10:30 or so since i have a lot of stuff to get Laoded & unloaded..
We cant wait around for an hour as i have in the past when everyone is ready to go.
Yes im the last one since i help as many as i can get going (ie foot pegs.etc). But most of you know how to do this so only a few need help now ?

From the last event(s)-- i have one nice salad bowl in the found box, a plate and other stuff, please check the box for your things..

Bring a lunch snack for some shoreline area stop along the way.

Bring your chairs, PotLuck food and your favourite beverage for the Barbie-q just 3 minutes drive away from the boat ramp. I will have the Grill and maybe the Pop Up Can-O-Pee, table also, etc.

I have some Hut Doags and Portogeezer buns (i like them better than the Hut Doags) and im sure you may also.

This is a lake and slow river type environment, miles and time are Dependant on the group paddling speed, distance, and desires. When we had enough, its head back, load up, and Barbie-Q time.

I would like to start off by going downstream (under the tunnel) to the big lake area first then head up the river near the airport that passes through Diana's Pool (Name i forgit) till we are bored with it, or reach a point of too shallow depth.
On our return trip we hit a good lunch spot that we seen on the way that looks sandy or interesting.


#######

Getting There:
Mansfield Hollow Boat Launch:

For GPS use # 300 Bassetts Bridge Road Mansfield Center CT, (its close enough).
mapquest or other, just compare the directions below to what you get, they should be similar.

From Hartford --- I - 84 East to---> I-384 East toward Bolton, bear right onto rte 6 at the (44 - 6 split) and follow rte 6 toward Willimantic.
-
rte 6 and rte 66 will intersect at a light. Take a left on to rte 6.
-
Follow this section of highway to the second exit, take the exit and go straight (=rte 633 or S. Frontage Rd.) it is actually a parallel to rte 6 as a connector to rte 195, (and heads towards the Mall & food store, etc)
-
Signs for UCONN should be there somewhere too.
-
At the end of the connector, take a left and Go North on rte 195 towards UCONN for about 2 miles then turn right at the onto Basset Bridge Rd,
-
Go apx 1 mile on Bassetts Bridge Rd.
-
You Will see a picknick area on left but go a bit further (apx 0.5 miles) to the boat ramp access before the Bassetts bridge on the left.
-
The picknick area you passed is where will go after the paddling is done.
-
At the boat launch, i will park as close to the bridge tunnels as i can, so look for me in that area.


xxxxxxxxxxxxx
Kayaks available:

A Paddle & Paddle Leash, Life Jacket with whistle is included with any of my yaks.

Doughnation of $ 20.00, bucks for my kayaks reserved for this particular event.
Its way less than what sport shops charge and the yaks & Paddles are top quality delivered and picked up at the site etc..

Please make sure you are familiar with the yak you choose and can fit in them since i don't have any "Wide Butt" (greater than 17"~18" butts) yaks anymore.
Don't laugh, its serious, some will not fit in a yak thats too small (ie the Greenlander Pro--maximum butt and hips width of 12 inches limit) of an opening and i will feel sad you cant go..etc..the other option is to maybe trade with someone, etc, if you need to.
This has worked in the past very well.

I can only bring the yaks that are confirmed by a positive confirmed yes and by persons i have some idea to match a boat to a paddle skill.

Maybee's obviously can't reserve any yaks & if ya reserve one and don't show up, ya won't ever get a second chance to again unless its some real good excuse. Sorry i don't like to leave un-attended yaks on the trailer. They could get stolen too easily.


Please if using my yaks avoid stepping on the floor of them to get in and out and NEVER DRIVE UP ON SHORE WITH THEM LIKE YOU ARE GOING TO A DRIVE IN MOVIE. (Kate has to repair all the damage you make to the fiberglass and Gel coatings by doing this.)

Only Novices in short wide cheap plastic boats do that kind of thing because they simply don't know any better or don't care.

READ THE INFO ON THE FOLLOWING LINK: I will also show you the correct way & you will look like a intelligent seasoned pro to impress the others who don't know how. Then you may laugh at the ones that fall in on entry - exit who don't know how.
http://www.ehow.com/h...
Hint: Always enter- exit any kayak while being parallel and close to shore.
-----------------
Please review the links below for the equipment specifications to be at least familiar with which boat or equipment you would be best suited for.

Cheap LIfe Jackets with a whistle is all i have for most of you since a GOOD QUALITY LIFE JACKET should be chosen for your particular body shapes , paddling style, and fit adjusted, if you have your own please bring it.
----------------------
I only have one "GOOD" life jacket for someone that can fit in it.
Its a Medium Kokatat* Ladies MsFit Tour: (this is also purchased by guys since it has a great fit and versatility) Its really too small for me, but i like the way it works.

http://www.rei.com/pr...

------------------
All my yaks come with the CHEAP Werner Carbon Kalliste Paddles because they are Hollow and light (my recommended brand and type). Different lengths (220-230) and types (strait, or ergonomic bent, small and normal shaft dia's.) of the same version are in the bucket.
You choose your preference.

http://www.wernerpadd...

(No ya cant use these paddles for paddle float entry practice. i have some metal ones for that.)
------------------

Also for comfort is my favourite "Yak Pad's" optional accessory to all yaks on trips that we are actually going somewhere.

http://www.yakpads.co...

-----------------

BOW DECK BAGS are now placed on kayaks to hold water , accessories and other items needed for quick and easy access:

http://www.kayakprosh...

------------------
Eddyline Wind Dancer 18', Red, Rudder Equipped.
For almost any sized paddler apx (100 to 240 lbs) with beginner and up skills.

http://www.epinions.c...

highly stable (initial & secondary) comfortable Sea kayak, 18'=
---------- ---RESERVED FOR LAURA ---

-------------------------

NDK Greenlander Pro 18', Red, Skeg Equipped.
Medium sized paddler (150-200 lbs) with Intermediate to Advanced skills.
12 Inch Butt Max width between hip pads..

http://www.atlanticka...

Fast Greenland style Sea kayak, moderated stability, 18'= --- if you ready for it..--- --- reserved by al-r--.

------------------------

Necky Eliza Advanced Composite (Un Modified), Red and White, Skeg Version 15.25'.
Small to Medium sized paddler (100 - 175 lbs) with Beginner and up skills.
This is the medium size cockpit of the Eliza series.

http://www.belhavenca...

stable and predictable Transitional type Light weight (43 LB) Ladies Kayak, 15'3.0"=
----- ---- ---RESERVED FOR MARY ----

----------------------

Necky Eliza Composite Ultra Light Version (Very Thin Fiberglass and floor reinforced), Yellow, Skeg Version 15.25'.
Small to Medium sized paddler (100 - 175 lbs) with Beginner and up skills.
This is the lightest of the Eliza Series and also with the smallest cocpit.

http://www.belhavenca...

stable and predictable Transitional type Light weight (40 LB) Ladies Kayak, 15'3.0"=
-------- ---RESERVED FOR CYNTHIA---


----------------------

Necky Eliza Plastic, Fire Color, Rudder Equipped 15.3'.
Small to Medium sized paddler (100 - 175 lbs) with Beginner and up skills.
This is the heaviest model and largest cockpit of the Eliza series.

http://www.neckykayak...

stable and predictable Transitional type moderate weight (50 LB) ladies kayak, 15'3.5"= -----AVAILABLE----- ---- ----

---------------------

Cedar Strip Night Heron by Guillemot Kayaks 18'

Greenland Paddle available also if desired.

Medium Sized Paddler (apx 150 - 220 Lbs) with NOVICE/INTERMEDIATE and up skills.

http://www.guillemot-...

Overall a stable and predictable Sea kayak with Greenland style hull (50 lbs), 18' =
---------- ----RESERVED FOR ELSA --



See you there.
AL-r
item.how_to_find_us: Look for my Kayak Trailer - Orange Stryped Cones at boat "CARRY IN" area Orange Hat also.

group.who: River and Shore Kayak-r's of CT

item.name: MONDAY SEPT 6 - KAYAKING @ Mansfield Hollow Res & Pot Luck BBQ 3 minutes away.
